name: MOD 007B HE
notes: Aluminum CNC gasket-mounted hall effect board with Bluetooth 5.0, 2.4 GHz, and wired modes. Magnetic switches allow adjustable actuation points. 3600mAh battery. Strong contender in the wireless HE space.

name: RK68
notes: One of the most popular entry-level boards. Standard RK68 has single-color blue backlight (20 modes); the RK68 Plus variant has full RGB. BT 5.0 wireless with 1450mAh battery (~13 hours). Supports 3 device switching. Modding potential is huge; foam and tape mod transform the sound profile.

name: TH80 Pro
notes: Solid gasket implementation at this price point. Steel plate provides a firm typing feel. The rotary knob and tri-mode wireless (BT 5.0/2.4 GHz/USB-C) are appreciated. 4000mAh battery.

name: Q1 HE
notes: Keychron's hall effect flagship. 6063 aluminum CNC body with Gateron 2.0 double-rail magnetic Nebula switches. Bluetooth 5.2 and 2.4 GHz wireless with 1000Hz polling. QMK/VIA support via Keychron Launcher web configurator.

name: Q2
notes: Compact 65% with full QMK/VIA support. The double-gasket design gives a soft, bouncy typing feel. 6063 aluminum CNC body. Alternative plate options (aluminum, PC, FR4, brass) available separately. Wired only with 1000Hz polling.

name: V1
notes: Budget version of the Q1 in a plastic case. QMK/VIA support and screw-in stabilizers. Wired only with 1000Hz polling. The V1 Max variant adds wireless for slightly more. Community agrees this is the sweet spot for a first custom keyboard.

name: KBD67 Lite R5
notes: A community staple that defined the affordable gasket mount category. The R5 revision refines the silicone dampener and adds new colorways. Poppy, thocky sound out of the box.

name: Zoom65 V3
notes: The V3 features seven interchangeable gasket mount styles and an LCD screen. Default PC plate with optional aluminum, brass, and FR4 plates. Screwless quick assembly. BT 5.0/2.4 GHz/USB-C with 4500mAh battery. 16 colorways available.

name: QK65
notes: One of the best-sounding 65% boards in its class. V2 adds tri-mode wireless (BT/2.4 GHz/wired) and screwless magnetic assembly. Flex-cut FR4 plate option highly recommended. The Mk3 ($199+) adds a retro-themed smart display. Clean design with subtle weight on the back.

name: TH96
notes: One of the few affordable 96% (104-key) layouts with gasket mount and rotary knob. Tri-mode wireless (BT 5.0/2.4 GHz/USB-C). Massive 6000mAh battery. PBT thermal sublimation keycaps. Great for users who need a numpad in a compact footprint.

name: Air75 V2
notes: Low-profile mechanical that doesn't feel like a compromise. BT 5.1/2.4 GHz/USB-C with 4000mAh battery. QMK/VIA firmware support. Includes Airfeet stands for laptop placement. Popular among Mac users. The V3 upgrades to gasket mount.

name: Q1 Pro
notes: The wireless upgrade to the beloved Q1. 6063 aluminum body with Broadcom BT 5.1 and 1000Hz wired polling. 4000mAh battery (~300 hours RGB off, ~90 hours lowest brightness). Full QMK/VIA support over both wireless and wired modes.

name: Sonnet
notes: Mode's 75% starting at $299 with extensive configurator options. Plate choices: FR4, POM, PC, aluminum, carbon fiber, brass, copper. QMK/VIA with hotswap and solder PCB options. Average build runs $400-450 with customization. This generation has ended production.

name: GMMK Pro
notes: Full CNC aluminum chassis weighing over 3 lbs with rotary knob. GSV2 pre-lubed stabilizers. The gasket mount is quite firm, giving an almost top-mount feel. Community recommends swapping to the PC or FR4 plate. Succeeded by GMMK 3 but still widely available.

name: IK75 Pro
notes: Sleeper hit in the budget 75% category. Tri-mode (BT 5.0/2.4 GHz/USB-C) with dual batteries totaling up to 10000mAh. EVA and Poron foam dampeners. Pre-lubed stabilizers. Knob control. Excellent value for the feature set.

name: Mammoth75
notes: Premium 75% with OLED screen, rotary encoder, and magnetic knobs (aluminum + brass). ~4kg weight. No per-key RGB. Multiple PCB options including wireless hotswap (M3). PORON foam dampening. Community praises the mammoth-shaped weight and anodization quality.

name: Tiger 80 Lite
notes: One of the most affordable gasket TKL kits. The PC plate gives a deep, muted sound. Community recommends it as the best budget TKL, though the plastic case can feel a bit hollow.

name: KBD75 V3.1
notes: A proven classic in the custom keyboard world. The V3.1 adds hotswap PCB with RGB underglow. 7-degree typing angle with acrylic mid-layer. Brass/aluminum/PC plate options and Cherry screw-in stabilizers. Clean, no-nonsense 75% with great heft.

name: Wind X98
notes: Premium modified 1800 layout in 6063 aluminum. R2 version offers dual mounting (top mount or gasket). 1.5mm PC plate. Bluetooth variant available for $335. Available in normal and southpaw configurations with swappable top cases. Group buy rounds sell out quickly.

name: Envoy
notes: Mode's accessible 65% starting at $189. Unique Flexible Block Mount system with Lattice (flexible) or Solid (firm) options. The configurator lets you mix materials for top and bottom case halves. Exceptional fit and finish. Community calls the typing feel 'buttery smooth.'

name: Spring
notes: 65% Alice-layout board with iconic leaf-spring mounting using 8 beryllium copper springs. ~2kg, 7-degree typing angle. Plate options: aluminum, FR4, PC, POM. Includes Owlstabs stabilizers and carrying case. Produces a uniquely bouncy and deep sound. Aftermarket prices exceed retail significantly.

name: No.2/65
notes: The pinnacle of boutique custom keyboards. Isolated gasket sandwich mount with PTFE plate-alignment pins. Three-part hidden screw construction. VIA-compatible WT65-G (solder) and WT65-H1 (hotswap) PCB options. Manufactured in-house at Keycult Workshop. Raffle-only sales; aftermarket exceeds $2000.

name: Satisfaction 75
notes: Designed by Upas, sold by CannonKeys (ai03 contributed to the PCB design). Famous for its integrated OLED screen and rotary encoder. Brass plate gives a bright, pingy sound. The Sat75 X successor adds gasket mount and hotswap at $111. Extremely limited original group buy runs.

name: Iron180
notes: Legendary TKL with full gasket isolation mount using 12 custom-cut PORON gaskets. 7-degree typing angle, sub-17mm front height, seamless case design. WK and WKL top options. Aluminum base ($635) or brass base ($935). QMK/VIA PCB by Gondolindrim. A true endgame board.

name: Q65
notes: Keychron's unique 65% with extra macro column and programmable knob. 6063 aluminum CNC body with double-gasket design. Full QMK/VIA support with 1000Hz polling. The Q65 Max adds wireless (BT/2.4 GHz) for ~$209. A strong contender in the mid-range 65% segment.

name: V3 Max
notes: The V3 Max bridges the gap between Keychron's budget V-series and premium Q-series. Gasket mount in a plastic-aluminum hybrid body with tri-mode wireless (BT 5.1/2.4 GHz/USB-C). QMK/VIA via Keychron Launcher. 4000mAh battery. Excellent value with wireless and gasket at this price.

name: K8 Pro
notes: Keychron's wireless TKL with QMK/VIA support. Double-gasket mount in a plastic shell with BT 5.1 and 4000mAh battery. RGB south-facing LEDs. Mac and Windows compatible with included keycaps for both. Great option for those who need a wireless TKL with full programmability.

name: Zoom65 Essential Edition
notes: The more affordable Zoom65 variant without the LCD screen. Same gasket mount system and build quality as the V3 but at a lower price. FR4 plate gives a soft, bouncy feel. Wireless via BT 5.0 and 2.4 GHz. A popular entry into the mid-range 65% market.

name: KBD67 Lite R4
notes: The R4 revision of the community-favorite KBD67 Lite. Gasket mount with silicone dampener in a transparent ABS shell. PC plate for bouncy, poppy typing. Screw-in stabilizers included. A proven, reliable kit that continues to define the budget gasket category.

name: Shadow-X
notes: Epomaker's mid-range 65% with aluminum case and gasket mount. FR4 plate gives moderate flex. Tri-mode wireless (BT 5.0/2.4 GHz/USB-C). South-facing LEDs with per-key RGB. Rotary knob for volume control. Strong value proposition in the $120 65% segment.

name: RK84
notes: One of the most affordable wireless 75% keyboards. Tray mount with steel plate in a plastic case. BT 5.0/2.4 GHz/USB-C triple mode. Hot-swappable switches. Knob for volume. The modding community loves this board for its low entry price and massive mod potential.

name: Professional Hybrid
notes: The iconic Happy Hacking Keyboard with Topre electrostatic capacitive switches. Unique layout designed for Unix programmers. Bluetooth and USB-C. Topre switches offer a smooth, thocky feel unlike any MX switch. Not MX-compatible. The layout takes getting used to but devotees swear by it.

name: R3
notes: Premium Topre TKL from Realforce. Electrostatic capacitive switches with adjustable actuation (APC). Bluetooth 5.0 and USB-C. 30g/45g/55g uniform or variable weight options. Silenced variant available. Not MX-compatible. Legendary durability and typing feel.

name: M1
notes: Incredible value CNC aluminum 75% with gasket mount. Full aluminum case and plate at under $90 is remarkable. South-facing LEDs, screw-in stabilizers, rotary knob. The community considers this the best budget aluminum board available. VIA support.

name: M5
notes: One of the very few full-size gasket mount keyboards. CNC aluminum case with hot-swap and rotary knob. South-facing LEDs. Great for users who need a numpad without sacrificing build quality. VIA support. Hard to find a better full-size custom at this price.

name: IK75 Pro V2
notes: Updated IK75 Pro with PC plate for a softer, bouncier feel. Triple-mode wireless with massive 10000mAh dual battery. EVA and Poron foam dampeners. Pre-lubed stabilizers. Knob control. Possibly the best value wireless 75% for under $70.
